details.title: Calculation of three dimensional electrostatic field in potential transformers
details.abstract: The electrostatic field in 500 kV potential transformers has been simulated with three dimensianal (3-D) models. The main purpose of calculating the electrostatic field is to investigate the effect of electrostatic shiel ding in transformers and to see if the shielding can be removed. The conclusions are that the shielding on the middle of the winding is not clearly profitable to the maximum electrostatic field strength and can be removed. To calculate the field a 3-D finite element software has been developed which is based on a powerful tetrahedral mesh generator. Meanwhile, axisymmetric models are also employed to simulate the effect of the shielding.
